edu.biu.scapi.comm.twoPartyComm

Interface DestroyDestinationUtil

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ActiveMQCommunicationSetup.ActiveMQDestroyer

    public interface DestroyDestinationUtil
    This interface provide a way to destroy the queues created by the QueueChannels.

    Since the JMS architecture has no function to destroy the destinations and the destruction is done in the implementation level, we can not have a destroy function in the Queue Channel (since it uses the high level JMS functions). Thus, we should provide another way to destroy it. Our solution is to have a class that do the destruction and we pass it to the channel. When the time comes, the channel will call the destroy function of the instance it has.

    Author:
    Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Moriya Farbstein)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void destroyDestination(javax.jms.Connection connection, javax.jms.Destination destinationName)
      Destroy the given Destination which have been created by the given connection.

      • destroyDestination

        void destroyDestination(javax.jms.Connection connection,
                      javax.jms.Destination destinationName)
                        throws javax.jms.JMSException
        Destroy the given Destination which have been created by the given connection.
        Parameters:
        connection - used to create the destination.
        destinationName - the name of the destination that should be distract.
        Throws:
        javax.jms.JMSException
